name: Manhattan
instructions: Stir ingredients with ice, strain into a chilled coupe glass, and garnish with a cherry.
notes: A timeless classic. Use a bold rye whiskey and good vermouth for balance.

name: Black Manhattan
instructions: Stir ingredients with ice until chilled, strain into a coupe glass, and garnish with a cherry or orange peel.
notes: A darker twist on the Manhattan, richer and slightly herbal from the amaro.

name: Old Fashioned
instructions: Muddle sugar and bitters with water, add bourbon, stir with ice, and garnish with orange twist.
notes: Simple, smooth, and spirit-forward. The benchmark for whiskey cocktails.

name: Sazerac
instructions: Rinse a chilled rocks glass with absinthe. Muddle sugar and bitters, add whiskey, stir with ice, and strain into the prepared glass.
notes: A New Orleans classic—aromatic, potent, and rich in history.

name: Dry Martini
instructions: Stir ingredients with ice, strain into a chilled martini glass, and garnish with a lemon twist or olive.
notes: Elegant and crisp. Adjust vermouth ratio to taste—less for drier, more for balance.

name: Pisco Sour
instructions: Shake all ingredients without ice, then shake again with ice. Strain into a coupe glass and garnish with Angostura bitters.
notes: Silky and tart with a light foam cap. A South American favorite.

name: Paper Plane
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a coupe glass.
notes: Modern and balanced—equal parts sweet, bitter, and sour perfection.

name: Cosmopolitan
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lime twist.
notes: Bright, tart, and sophisticated. The ultimate 90s revival done right.

name: Aperol Spritz
instructions: Combine prosecco and Aperol in a glass with ice. Top with soda water and garnish with an orange slice.
notes: Light and refreshing. Perfect for warm afternoons or brunch.

name: Perfect Manhattan
instructions: Stir ingredients with ice, strain into a chilled coupe glass, and garnish with a cherry or lemon twist.
notes: A refined Manhattan with half sweet and half dry vermouth—balanced and nuanced.

name: Margarita
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a salt-rimmed margarita glass.
notes: Bright and zesty. Balance your lime and sweetness for a perfect sip.

name: Lion’s Tail
instructions: Shake ingredients with ice and strain into a coupe glass. Garnish with a lime twist.
notes: A hidden gem—spicy and rich with warm baking spice notes.

name: Gold Rush
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice.
notes: Smooth, simple, and bright. A modern whiskey classic.

name: Brown Derby
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a coupe glass.
notes: Light and citrusy with honey sweetness—balanced and refreshing.

name: Whiskey Sour
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice (dry shake first if using egg white). Strain into a rocks glass over ice and garnish with a cherry or orange slice.
notes: A perfect mix of tart and sweet. Add egg white for extra smoothness.

name: Bee’s Knees
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice until well-chilled, then strain into a chilled coupe glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
notes: A Prohibition-era classic: floral gin meets bright lemon and smooth honey for a crisp, sweet-tart sip.

name: Boulevardier
instructions: Stir whiskey (or bourbon), Campari and sweet vermouth with ice until well chilled. Strain into a chilled rocks glass (or coupé) and garnish with an orange twist.
notes: A rich & bittersweet variation of the Negroni—warm from whiskey, sharp from Campari, balanced by sweet vermouth.

name: Clover Club
instructions: Add gin, lemon juice, raspberry syrup and egg white into a shaker with ice; shake vigorously until chilled. Strain into a chilled coupe glass and garnish with 3 raspberries.
notes: A pre-Prohibition classic from Philadelphia—floral gin, tart lemon, sweet raspberry and silky foam from the egg white.
